= mudday =

== Syntax ==
 variable: '''mudday''' (Read-only)

== Description ==
The '''mudday''' variable returns the current day number in the MUD's internal time system. This built-in variable allows DIL programs to track and respond to the passage of time within the game world, enabling time-based events, scheduling, and conditional logic.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| Read || integer || Returns the current day number (0-based)
|}

== Examples ==
 dilbegin daily_reset();
 var
    current_day : integer;
    last_reset : integer;
 code
 {
    :init:
    last_reset := mudday;
    
    :check_reset:
    current_day := mudday;
    
    // Check if a new day has started
    if (current_day != last_reset)
    {
       exec("say A new day begins!", self);
       last_reset := current_day;
    }
    
    pause;
    goto check_reset;
 } dilend

 dilbegin time_based_event();
 var
    day_hour : integer;
 code
 {
    // Calculate total hours since epoch
    day_hour := mudhour + mudday * MUD_DAY;
    
    // Check if it's morning (hours 6-11)
    if ((mudhour >= 6) and (mudhour < 12))
    {
       exec("say Good morning! The sun is rising.", self);
    }
    // Check if it's evening (hours 18-21)
    else if ((mudhour >= 18) and (mudhour < 22))
    {
       exec("say Good evening! The day is ending.", self);
    }
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The '''mudday''' variable is read-only and cannot be modified
* Day numbers typically start from 0 and increment each MUD day
* Used in conjunction with '''mudhour''' for complete time tracking
* The '''MUD_DAY''' constant represents the number of hours in one MUD day
* Time calculations often use the formula: `total_hours = mudhour + mudday * MUD_DAY`

== Error Handling ==
* The variable is always available and does not generate runtime errors
* Returns valid integer values in all contexts
